topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1917–1972, Volume VI, Public Diplomacy, 1961–1963
topic.body: This volume documents the public diplomacy efforts of the John F. Kennedy administration. A major emphasis of the volume is the role the United States Information Agency, led by Edward R. Murrow, played in presenting U.S. foreign policy objectives to the world during a time of social change within the United States.
topic.image-description: Book Cover of Foreign Relations of the United States, 1917–1972, Volume VI, Public Diplomacy, 1961–1963
topic.image-source-information: Created by the Office of the Historian
